snippet: The decision by a federal appeals court panel that Proposition 8 violated people’s rights all but ensured that the case would proceed to the United States Supreme Court.
abstract: Federal appeals court strikes down California's voter-approved ban on same-sex marriage passed in 2008, upholding a lower court's ruling that the ban violates the constitutional rights of gay men and lesbians in the state; the 2-1 decision found that the disparate treatment of married couples and domestic partners after the ban's passage violates the Constitution's Equal Protection Clause.

byline.contributor: John Schwartz contributed reporting from New York, and Ian Lovett from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The decision by a federal appeals court panel that Proposition 8 violated people’s rights all but ensured that the case would proceed to the United States Supreme Court.

headline.seo: California Ban on Gay Marriage Is Struck Down
headline.main: Court Strikes Down Ban on Gay Marriage in California
headline.print_headline: California Ban On Gay Unions Is Struck Down

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
